summary.long: Ephesians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God,
To the saints who are in Ephesus, and are faithful in Christ Jesus:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in Christ with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and blameless before him. In love
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he predestined us for adoption as sons through Jesus Christ, according to the purpose of his will,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the praise of his glorious grace, with which he has blessed us in the Beloved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which he lavished upon us, in all wisdom and insight
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: making known to us the mystery of his will, according to his purpose, which he set forth in Christ
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as a plan for the fullness of time, to unite all things in him, things in heaven and things on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him we have obtained an inheritance, having been predestined according to the purpose of him who works all things according to the counsel of his will,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we who were the first to hope in Christ might be to the praise of his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him you also, when you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation, and believed in him, were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who is the guarantee of our inheritance until we acquire possession of it, to the praise of his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, because I have heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love towards all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not cease to give thanks for you, remembering you in my prayers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give you a spirit of wisdom and of revelation in the knowledge of him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having the eyes of your hearts enlightened, that you may know what is the hope to which he has called you, what are the riches of his glorious inheritance in the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what is the immeasurable greatness of his power towards us who believe, according to the working of his great might
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he worked in Christ when he raised him from the dead and seated him at his right hand in the heavenly places,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: far above all rule and authority and power and dominion, and above every name that is named, not only in this age but also in the one to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put all things under his feet and gave him as head over all things to the church,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you were dead in the trespasses and sins
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which you once walked, following the course of this world, following the prince of the power of the air, the spirit that is now at work in the sons of disobedience—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: among whom we all once lived in the passions of our flesh, carrying out the desires of the body and the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, like the rest of mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God, being rich in mercy, because of the great love with which he loved us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even when we were dead in our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ—by grace you have been saved—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and raised us up with him and seated us with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that in the coming ages he might show the immeasurable riches of his grace in kindness towards us in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not a result of works, so that no one may boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand, that we should walk in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore remember that at one time you Gentiles in the flesh, called “the uncircumcision” by what is called the circumcision, which is made in the flesh by hands—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: remember that you were at that time separated from Christ, alienated from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers to the covenants of promise, having no hope and without God in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he himself is our peace, who has made us both one and has broken down in his flesh the dividing wall of hostility
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by abolishing the law of commandments expressed in ordinances, that he might create in himself one new man in place of the two, so making peace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and might reconcile us both to God in one body through the cross, thereby killing the hostility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came and preached peace to you who were far off and peace to those who were near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For through him we both have access in one Spirit to the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then you are no longer strangers and aliens, but you are fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the cornerstone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom the whole structure, being joined together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him you also are being built together into a dwelling place for God by the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I, Paul, a prisoner for Christ Jesus on behalf of you Gentiles—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: assuming that you have heard of the stewardship of God's grace that was given to me for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how the mystery was made known to me by revelation, as I have written briefly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you read this, you can perceive my insight into the mystery of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which was not made known to the sons of men in other generations as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This mystery is that the Gentiles are fellow heirs, members of the same body, and partakers of the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of this gospel I was made a minister according to the gift of God's grace, which was given me by the working of his power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To me, though I am the very least of all the saints, this grace was given, to preach to the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to bring to light for everyone what is the plan of the mystery hidden for ages in God who created all things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that through the church the manifold wisdom of God might now be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was according to the eternal purpose that he has realized in Christ Jesus our Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have boldness and access with confidence through our faith in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I ask you not to lose heart over what I am suffering for you, which is your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I bow my knees before the Father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that according to the riches of his glory he may grant you to be strengthened with power through his Spirit in your inner being,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith—that you, being rooted and grounded in love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: may have strength to comprehend with all the saints what is the breadth and length and height and depth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to know the love of Christ that surpasses knowledge, that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to him who is able to do far more abundantly than all that we ask or think, according to the power at work within us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to him be glory in the church and in Christ Jesus throughout all generations, for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I therefore, a prisoner for the Lord, urge you to walk in a manner worthy of the calling to which you have been called,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all humility and gentleness, with patience, bearing with one another in love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eager to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is one body and one Spirit—just as you were called to the one hope that belongs to your call—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one God and Father of all, who is over all and through all and in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But grace was given to each one of us according to the measure of Christ's gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore it says,
“When he ascended on high he led a host of captives,
    and he gave gifts to men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (In saying, “He ascended”, what does it mean but that he had also descended into the lower regions, the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who descended is the one who also ascended far above all the heavens, that he might fill all things.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the shepherds and teachers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to equip the saints for the work of ministry, for building up the body of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until we all attain to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to mature manhood, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we may no longer be children, tossed to and fro by the waves and carried about by every wind of doctrine, by human cunning, by craftiness in deceitful schemes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, speaking the truth in love, we are to grow up in every way into him who is the head, into Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from whom the whole body, joined and held together by every joint with which it is equipped, when each part is working properly, makes the body grow so that it builds itself up in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this I say and testify in the Lord, that you must no longer walk as the Gentiles do, in the futility of their minds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are darkened in their understanding, alienated from the life of God because of the ignorance that is in them, due to their hardness of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have become callous and have given themselves up to sensuality, greedy to practise every kind of impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that is not the way you learned Christ!—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: assuming that you have heard about him and were taught in him, as the truth is in Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to put off your old self, which belongs to your former manner of life and is corrupt through deceitful desires,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to be renewed in the spirit of your minds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to put on the new self, created after the likeness of God in true righteousness and holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, having put away falsehood, let each one of you speak the truth with his neighbour, for we are members one of another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be angry and do not sin; do not let the sun go down on your anger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and give no opportunity to the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the thief no longer steal, but rather let him labour, doing honest work with his own hands, so that he may have something to share with anyone in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamour and slander be put away from you, along with all malice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be kind to one another, tender-hearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be imitators of God, as beloved children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And walk in love, as Christ loved us and gave himself up for us, a fragrant offering and sacrifice to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But sexual immorality and all impurity or covetousness must not even be named among you, as is proper among saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let there be no filthiness nor foolish talk nor crude joking, which are out of place, but instead let there be thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you may be sure of this, that everyone who is sexually immoral or impure, or who is covetous (that is, an idolater), has no inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one deceive you with empty words, for because of these things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do not become partners with them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for at one time you were darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Walk as children of light
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for the fruit of light is found in all that is good and right and true),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and try to discern what is pleasing to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take no part in the unfruitful works of darkness, but instead expose them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is shameful even to speak of the things that they do in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when anything is exposed by the light, it becomes visible,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for anything that becomes visible is light. Therefore it says,
“Awake, O sleeper,
    and arise from the dead,
and Christ will shine on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look carefully then how you walk, not as unwise but as wise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: making the best use of the time, because the days are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do not be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not get drunk with wine, for that is debauchery, but be filled with the Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: addressing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody to the Lord with your heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks always and for everything to God the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: submitting to one another out of reverence for Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, submit to your own husbands, as to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the husband is the head of the wife even as Christ is the head of the church, his body, and is himself its Saviour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as the church submits to Christ, so also wives should submit in everything to their husbands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives, as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he might sanctify her, having cleansed her by the washing of water with the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that he might present the church to himself in splendour, without spot or wrinkle or any such thing, that she might be holy and without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way husbands should love their wives as their own bodies. He who loves his wife loves himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one ever hated his own flesh, but nourishes and cherishes it, just as Christ does the church,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because we are members of his body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore a man shall leave his father and mother and hold fast to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This mystery is profound, and I am saying that it refers to Christ and the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, let each one of you love his wife as himself, and let the wife see that she respects her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Honour your father and mother” (this is the first commandment with a promise),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “that it may go well with you and that you may live long in the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves, obey your earthly masters with fear and trembling, with a sincere heart, as you would Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not by the way of eye-service, as people-pleasers, but as servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rendering service with a good will as to the Lord and not to man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that whatever good anyone does, this he will receive back from the Lord, whether he is a slave or free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Masters, do the same to them, and stop your threatening, knowing that he who is both their Master and yours is in heaven, and that there is no partiality with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put on the whole armour of God, that you may be able to stand against the schemes of the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not wrestle against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the cosmic powers over this present darkness, against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore take up the whole armour of God, that you may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stand therefore, having fastened on the belt of truth, and having put on the breastplate of righteousness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, as shoes for your feet, having put on the readiness given by the gospel of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all circumstances take up the shield of faith, with which you can extinguish all the flaming darts of the evil one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praying at all times in the Spirit, with all prayer and supplication. To that end keep alert with all perseverance, making supplication for all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also for me, that words may be given to me in opening my mouth boldly to proclaim the mystery of the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which I am an ambassador in chains, that I may declare it boldly, as I ought to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that you also may know how I am and what I am doing, Tychicus the beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord will tell you everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent him to you for this very purpose, that you may know how we are, and that he may encourage your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peace be to the brothers, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be with all who love our Lord Jesus Christ with love incorruptible.
verses.speaker: Narrator
